p: Tree growth is modeled based on generalized physiological principles, simulating primary production by means of a light use efficiency approach (Landsberg and Waring 1997). C allocation to tree compartments is based on allometric ratios and dynamically adapts to the abiotic and biotic environment of an individual tree. Compartment‐specific turnover rates are used to calculate the C input into four detrital pools, for which a decomposition module calculates C storage and release from the ecosystem (Seidl et al. 2012b). A process‐based water balance is calculated at a daily time step, allowing the simulation of canopy interception and evapotranspiration of water as well as snow cover and water runoff.
